books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel set in the Jazz Age that explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A timeless novel of a child's moral awakening and a poignant tale of race and justice in the American South.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel that also serves as a social commentary on the British landed gentry of the early 19th century.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A story about a young boyâ€™s journey through the challenges of adolescence.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A novel about a technologically advanced future society, exploring themes of conformity and individuality.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A philosophical story about a shepherd's journey to realize his personal legend.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: A story about a young man who remains eternally young while his portrait ages, reflecting his moral decay.
